(3, 1, 1): Reading, listening, speaking and writing of the English language.
(4, 1, 1): To assess the English language proficiency of non-native English speakers.
(6, 1, 1): Internet-based test (iBT): 3 hours 10 minutes to 4 hours 20 minutes (excluding 10-minute break in-between). ,  Paper-based test (PBT): 2 hours 20 minutes to 2 hours 30 minutes.
(7, 1, 1): iBT: ,  0 to 30 (in 1 point increments) on each of the 4 sections. So total of 0 to 120. ,  PBT: ,  Listening: 31 to 68, Structure: 31 to 69, Reading: 31 to 67. Total of 310 to 677. Writing (separate): 0 to 6. (All in 1 point increments.)
(9, 1, 1): iBT: More than 50 times a year.
(10, 1, 1): iBT: Can be taken only once in any 12-day period.
(14, 1, 1): No official prerequisite. Intended for non-native English speakers.
(15, 1, 1): iBT: US$ 160 to US$ 260, depending on the country. ,  PBT: US$ 180.
(16, 1, 1): More than 10,000 colleges, agencies and other institutions in over 130 countries.
